alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:17PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Colbert and Franklin Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 516 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Tishomingo State Park to Belgreen to near Hackleburg. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Red Bay, Phil Campbell, Belgreen, Vina, Hodges, Malone, Pogo, Cedar Creek Reservoir, Atwood and Srygley Church. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
